In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

In Julia, you can define the `wrap_string` function as follows:

```julia
function wrap_string(text::AbstractString; text_width::Int = 10)
    lines = []
    for word in split(text)
        if length(word) + sum(length.(lines)) > text_width
            push!(lines, "")
        end
        push!(lines, word)
    end
    return join(lines; separator="\n")
end
```

This function takes a `text` string and an optional `text_width` parameter (defaulting to 10 characters per line). It splits the text into words and then iterates over them, adding each word to a new line if it would exceed the maximum line width when combined with the current length of all lines.

Here's an example usage:

```julia
julia> wrap_string("Hello there! This is a very long sentence that I want to wrap into multiple lines.")
"Hello there!\nThis is a very long\nsentence that I want to\nwrap into multiple\nlines."
```

In this example, the function has wrapped the text at each space character before the length of the line plus the word exceeds `text_width`.
